posts.post_content:
Contains 24 cards. 

Side 1

3 T205's with Huggins being by far the nicest.

7 T206's with a postally cancelled Anderson which is kinda weird.

2 E91-C

The baseball cards are barley attached. I can see all the backs just by bending the page. I can also guarantee these will safely soak as another board member won the other three pages in the auction these were in and he has already successfully removed all of his.

The back contains 12 t59 Flags of all nations. These are glued more thoroughly, though I imagine with the same glue, oddly they appear to have had back damage before they were glued into the album so these will be low grade even when successfully removed.

Asking $300 now $240 shipped Priority insured at no extra cost.

[IMG]https://d28lcup14p4e72.cloudfront.net/220100/4774701/Scan_20190906.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]https://d28lcup14p4e72.cloudfront.net/220100/4774702/Scan_20190906%20(2).jpg[/IMG]

Scott- it looks like the T206 Anderson was postally canceled. That's really interesting, I've never seen that before. It looks like it was placed on a envelope where the stamp belonged. How could that be? Pretty cool.

I mention the postal cancellation in my description. The last letter of the town is G, and the State is PA so it must've occurred after the switch to two letter abbreviations (1963) which is weird. I've had a lot of offers for that card if I was going to soak it. I have in the past (and disclosed it as my Parsippany customers can attest to) but I just don't want to anymore. I still don't think it's wrong (especially with disclosure) but I can't see myself doing it anymore. I bought this sheet before the scandal and never got around to it.
The pictures in the post appear blurry, is it just me?
Definitely blurry. Weird they were fine the other day. I'll change them out and see what happens.

[quote name="Aquarian Sports Cards" post=1915073]Definitely blurry. Weird they were fine the other day. I'll change them out and see what happens.[/QUOTE]

Clear now Scott.

Thanks, guessing it's some weird photobucket bandwidth issue.

Anyway lets drop it to $260 and see if we get a bite. Less that $22 per baseball card and the flags for free! The Huggins has a real shot at a 5 and an outside shot at a 6 due to centering and general eye-appeal.
Hey Gang, one last price drop to $240. Sheet will be with me at Valley Forge if you want to see it in person.
